bibl.title: Letter from S.D. Avery to Laura Armistead Carter, September 15, 1925

div1.p: Avery lists resolutions adopted by the Medical Association of the Isthmian Canal Zone upon the death of Henry Carter.

div1.head: Letter from S.D. Avery to Laura Armistead Carter, September 15, 1925
div1.opener:
MEDICAL ASSOCIATION OF THE ISTHMIAN CANAL ZONE
Sept.17,1925
Miss Laura Rose Carter,
Washington, D.C.
Dear Madam:
div1.p:
At a meeting of the above Society held on
September 15, 1925, the following resolutions were adopted.

WHEREAS: The Medical Association of the Isthmian Canal Zone has
just learned of the death of Dr. Henry Rose Carter in Washington, D.C.,
on September 14, 1925, and

WHEREAS: Dr. Carter was a charter member of this Society, a per-
sonal friend to every doctor on the Canal Zone, an Executive in the
Sanitary Department of The Isthmian Canal Commission during the con-
struction period of The Panama Canal, and a physician to whom the peo-
ple of the Isthmus are indebted for his transcendent work in yellow
fever;

BE IT RESOLVED by The Medical Association of the Isthmian Canal
Zone in regular session convened that in the death of Dr. Henry Rose
Carter it has lost one of its most valued and distinguished members
and that it mourns the passing of a friend and beloved associate; and
further

BE IT RESOLVED that tjis Resolution be spread upon the minutes of
the Association and that a copy of it be transmitted to his family
with expressions of our sympathy.
